recap_documents.description: OPINION AND ORDER re: 41 MOTION to Dismiss partially the Amended Complaint. filed by Johnson & Johnson, Ethicon, Inc.. For the foregoing reasons, Defendants' motion to dismiss is GRANTED in part and DENIED in part. ChemImage's claims against J&J survive, at least for now, but its damages for the breach of contract claims, if proved, are limited to "(i) the agreed-upon $40 million termination fee, plus (ii) any damages that ChemImage can prove it would have incurred during the 120-day notice period from March 6 to July 4, 2023." Defs.' Mem. 16. Unless and until the Court orders otherwise, Defendants shall answer ChemImage's claims within two weeks of the date of this Opinion and Order. The Clerk of Court is directed to terminate ECF No. 41. SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Jesse M. Furman on 8/12/2024) (jca) (Entered: 08/12/2024)
